avalancheActivity.comment: A small slab was reported in Bláfjöll on February 22nd along with small sloughs and cornice fall.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Thawing has affected the snowpack up to the mountain tops, and a significant amount of snow has melted. The snowpack is now uniform and has strengthened in colder weather. Small wind slabs may have formed in in depressions and gullies during W-directions.

snowpackStructure.highlights: A significant amount of snow has melted during thaw on Sunday and Monday. During freezing on Tuesday, the snowpack strengthened again. Since then, there has been light snowfall in the area, and small wind slabs may have formed in east-facing gullies and valleys.

travelAdvisory.comment: The new snow is bonding poorly with older snow in the north part of Iceland and a few avalanches have released there. Snowfall on Sunday and rain on Monday may cause avalanches in the east.
travelAdvisory.highlights: The new snow is bonding poorly with older snow in the north part of Iceland and a few avalanches have released there. Snowfall on Sunday and rain on Monday may cause avalanches in the east.

weatherForecast.highlights: Norðan 8-15 á föstudag og úrkomulaust. Heldur hægari annað kvöld. Léttskýjað og frost 1 til 6 stig, en kólnar með kvöldinu.

avalancheActivity.comment: A few wet avalanches occurred during the thaw on Monday. A few avalanches occurred last week.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Small windslabs could be present on SW-aspects.

snowpackStructure.highlights: The thaw on Monday reached to high elevations. Snowfall this week during strong NE-winds might have formed windslabs on SW-aspects. The underlying snowpack has most likely become rather stable.

travelAdvisory.comment: The new snow is bonding poorly with older snow in the north part of Iceland and a few avalanches have released there. Snowfall on Sunday and rain on Monday may cause avalanches in the east.
travelAdvisory.highlights: The new snow is bonding poorly with older snow in the north part of Iceland and a few avalanches have released there. Snowfall on Sunday and rain on Monday may cause avalanches in the east.

weatherForecast.highlights: Breytilegar áttir næstu daga og þurrt að mestu. Hlýnar á sunnudag.

avalancheActivity.comment: A small avalanche was triggered by human activity on south facing aspect on Illviðrishnjúkur, 29.2.. Two avalanches released in Illviðrishnjúkur following snowfall on Tuesday, sized between 2 and 2.5. Several small slabs also fell in the area, along with small slabs in Ólafsfjörður. There was considerable avalanche activity in the region before the weekend and during the thaw on Monday. A slab avalanche was reported in Klaufabrekkuskarð, sized 2.5.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Weakness is present in the new snow. It is likely that it will accumulate into wind slabs on south-facing slopes when the wind picks up towards the mountains before the weekend. Travelers should beware of steep slopes and exercise caution.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Unstable layers are widespread after snowfall in a slow NW direction. Friday, this snow may form wind slabs in stronger N winds on S-aspects. A high temperature gradient has been measured in the snowpack after thaw on Monday, followed by cold weather. The weaknesses may continue to develop in the upper and lower layers of the snowpack in the ongoing cold over the next few days. Stability tests have shown fractures with light to moderate loads in the new snow. Propagation saw tests indicated that older weakness still breaks fairly easily, and faceted crystals are still present. However, significant stress is required for an avalanche to occur on that layer since the upper layers have stiffened and bridged the lower layers after thawing.

travelAdvisory.comment: The new snow is bonding poorly with older snow in the north part of Iceland and a few avalanches have released there. Snowfall on Sunday and rain on Monday may cause avalanches in the east.
travelAdvisory.highlights: The new snow is bonding poorly with older snow in the north part of Iceland and a few avalanches have released there. Snowfall on Sunday and rain on Monday may cause avalanches in the east.

weatherForecast.highlights: Norðaustan 5-10 og dálítil él við ströndina síðdegis á fimmtudag. Norðvestan 5-13 og él á föstudag.

avalancheActivity.comment: A skier triggered a slab avalanche of size 2 in Stafdalur on Feb 25th. Two other avalanches occurred in Seyðisfjörður the same day. An avalanche occurred in Grænafell on Feb 21.
avalancheActivity.highlights: It has snowed after the thaw on Monday. Windslabs are most likely present, especially on S-erly aspects.

snowpackStructure.highlights: It has snowed after the thaw on Monday and variable winds been in the area. Windslabs could be present on most aspects, but especially on southerly aspects. Strong northwesterly wind is forecasted on Friday which could form windslabs on southerly aspects.

travelAdvisory.comment: The new snow is bonding poorly with older snow in the north part of Iceland and a few avalanches have released there. Snowfall on Sunday and rain on Monday may cause avalanches in the east.
travelAdvisory.highlights: The new snow is bonding poorly with older snow in the north part of Iceland and a few avalanches have released there. Snowfall on Sunday and rain on Monday may cause avalanches in the east.

weatherForecast.highlights: N/NV-lægar áttir á föstudag og laugardag og líkur á dálítilli snjókomu. Á sunnudag er útlit fyrir hlýnandi austlægar áttir með snjókomu eða slyddu.
